Description: Body fragment of a small black-figured pottery open vessel; unglazed inside. Exterior: animal to left; remaining are the belly and the hindquarters in thin and streaky glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 93 no. 321 pl. 69)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2003)
